title: How to Bake Savoury Curried Biscuits
category_hierarchy: Crackers and Savory Cookies and Biscuits

steps.headline: Prepare the baking trays.
steps.description: Either line with baking paper or grease. Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.

steps.headline: Put the flour and salt into the mixing bowl.
Add the curry powder and both grated cheeses.
Rub in the softened butter using your fingertips.
steps.description: Keep rubbing until the mixture forms a soft dough.

steps.headline: Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface.
steps.description: Try to create a rectangular shape.

steps.headline: Cut the biscuits.
steps.description: Round shapes are good; use a biscuit cutter or the mouth of a glass.

steps.headline: Place the biscuits on the trays.
Place in the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the biscuits turn a golden brown colour.
Remove from the oven and leave to cool on the trays.
steps.description: Transfer to a cooling rack once cooled down a little and leave until cold.

steps.headline: Serve or store in an airtight container.

text: Prepare the baking trays. Either line with baking paper or grease. Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Put the flour and salt into the mixing bowl.  Add the curry powder and both grated cheeses.  Rub in the softened butter using your fingertips. Keep rubbing until the mixture forms a soft dough. Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface. Try to create a rectangular shape. Cut the biscuits. Round shapes are good; use a biscuit cutter or the mouth of a glass. Place the biscuits on the trays.  Place in the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the biscuits turn a golden brown colour.  Remove from the oven and leave to cool on the trays. Transfer to a cooling rack once cooled down a little and leave until cold. Serve or store in an airtight container.
